chart_description: This chart displays the CPU usage of different users, as a percentage of total CPU usage.

dimension_descriptions.1000: CPU usage of the user with the Linux ID 1000. This is typically the first non-root user created on a Linux system.
dimension_descriptions.1001: CPU usage of the user with the Linux ID 1001.
dimension_descriptions.65532: CPU usage of the user with the Linux ID 65532. This is typically the user used by the lighttpd web server.
dimension_descriptions.81: CPU usage of the user with the Linux ID 81. This is typically the user used by the cron daemon.
dimension_descriptions.messagebus: CPU usage of the user used by the D-Bus system message bus.
dimension_descriptions.netdata: CPU usage of the netdata system monitoring daemon.
dimension_descriptions.nobody: CPU usage of the 'nobody' user, which is used as a placeholder user with minimal privileges.
dimension_descriptions.nut: CPU usage of the Network UPS Tools daemon, which provides UPS monitoring and control software.
dimension_descriptions.root: CPU usage of the root user, which has superuser privileges.
dimension_descriptions.systemd-coredump: CPU usage of the systemd-coredump process, which provides coredump storage and retrieval.
dimension_descriptions.systemd-resolve: CPU usage of the systemd-resolve process, which provides DNS resolving services.
dimension_descriptions.xfs: CPU usage of the XFS file system maintenance daemon, which provides file system maintenance services.
